intro: Gymnobothrys lucida, commonly known as the slender liverwort, is a small, non-vascular plant belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its simple, leaf-like structures called thallus, which are typically flattened and green. Gymnobothrys lucida reproduces through spores, which are released from specialized structures called sporangia. Its morphology and habitat make it an important indicator species for assessing environmental conditions in its ecosystem.
